verses.kjv: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.web: Meanwhile, when a multitude of many thousands had gathered together, so much so that they trampled on each other, he began to tell his disciples first of all, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, a crowd of thousands had gathered — so many that people were trampling each other. Jesus turned first to his disciples and said, "Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

verses.kjv: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.
verses.web: But there is nothing covered up that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known.
verses.ct: Nothing that's covered up will stay hidden forever, and nothing kept secret will remain unknown.

verses.kjv: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
verses.web: Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. What you have spoken in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.ct: Whatever you've whispered in the dark will be heard in broad daylight, and what you've said behind closed doors will be shouted from the rooftops.

verses.kjv: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
verses.web: “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
verses.ct: "I'm telling you, my friends — don't be afraid of people who can kill the body but can't do anything more than that.

verses.kjv: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
verses.web: But I will warn you whom you should fear. Fear him who after he has killed, has power to cast into Gehenna. Yes, I tell you, fear him.
verses.ct: Let me tell you who to fear: fear the one who, after killing, has the power to throw you into hell. Yes, I'm telling you — fear him.

verses.kjv: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?
verses.web: “Aren’t five sparrows sold for two assaria coins? Not one of them is forgotten by God.
verses.ct: "Aren't 5 sparrows sold for just 2 small coins? Yet not a single one of them is forgotten by God.

verses.kjv: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.web: But the very hairs of your head are all counted. Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.ct: In fact, every hair on your head has been counted. So don't be afraid — you are worth far more than many sparrows.

verses.kjv: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
verses.web: “I tell you, everyone who confesses me before men, the Son of Man will also confess before the angels of God;
verses.ct: "I tell you, everyone who acknowledges me publicly will be acknowledged by the Son of Man before the angels of God.

verses.kjv: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.
verses.web: but he who denies me in the presence of men will be denied in the presence of God’s angels.
verses.ct: But whoever denies me in front of others will be denied before the angels of God.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.
verses.web: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but those who blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.ct: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.kjv: And when they bring you unto the synagogues, and unto magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:
verses.web: When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, don’t be anxious how or what you will answer, or what you will say;
verses.ct: When they drag you before synagogues, rulers, and authorities, don't worry about how to defend yourselves or what to say.

verses.kjv: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.
verses.web: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you must say.”
verses.ct: The Holy Spirit will teach you in that very moment what you need to say."

verses.kjv: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.
verses.web: One of the multitude said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.ct: Someone in the crowd called out, "Teacher, tell my brother to split the inheritance with me."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?
verses.web: But he said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Friend, who appointed me as a judge or mediator between you two?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
verses.web: He said to them, “Beware! Keep yourselves from covetousness, for a man’s life doesn’t consist of the abundance of the things which he possesses.”
verses.ct: Then he said to them all, "Be on your guard against every kind of greed, because a person's life isn't measured by how much they own."

verses.kjv: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:
verses.web: He spoke a parable to them, saying, “The ground of a certain rich man produced abundantly.
verses.ct: He told them a parable: "A rich man's land produced an enormous harvest.

verses.kjv: And he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?
verses.web: He reasoned within himself, saying, ‘What will I do, because I don’t have room to store my crops?’
verses.ct: He thought to himself, 'What am I going to do? I don't have enough room to store all my crops.'

verses.kjv: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.
verses.web: He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
verses.ct: Then he said, 'Here's what I'll do — I'll tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and I'll store all my grain and goods there.

verses.kjv: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, and be merry.
verses.web: I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, and be merry.” ’
verses.ct: Then I'll say to my soul, "Soul, you've got plenty stored up for years to come. Relax! Eat, drink, and enjoy yourself."'

verses.kjv: But God said unto him, Thou fool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?
verses.web: “But God said to him, ‘You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared—whose will they be?’
verses.ct: "But God said to him, 'You fool! Tonight your soul will be demanded from you. Then who will get everything you've stored up?'

verses.kjv: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
verses.web: So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”
verses.ct: That's how it is for anyone who hoards wealth for themselves but isn't rich toward God."

verses.kjv: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.
verses.web: He said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear.
verses.ct: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "That's why I tell you — stop worrying about your life, what you'll eat, or about your body, what you'll wear.

verses.kjv: The life is more than meat, and the body is more than raiment.
verses.web: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.
verses.ct: Life is about more than food, and the body is about more than clothing.

verses.kjv: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?
verses.web: Consider the ravens: they don’t sow, they don’t reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!
verses.ct: Look at the ravens: they don't plant or harvest, they have no storeroom or barn, yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!

verses.kjv: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
verses.web: Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?
verses.ct: Which of you can add a single cubit to your height by worrying about it?

verses.kjv: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?
verses.web: If then you aren’t able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?
verses.ct: If you can't even do something that small, why worry about the rest?

verses.kjv: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.web: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.ct: Look at how the lilies grow. They don't work or weave cloth. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed as beautifully as one of these.

verses.kjv: If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.web: But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?
verses.ct: If that's how God clothes the grass — here in the field today, thrown into the oven tomorrow — how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?

verses.kjv: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.
verses.web: Don’t seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.
verses.ct: So don't obsess over what you'll eat or what you'll drink. Don't let your mind be consumed with worry.

verses.kjv: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
verses.web: For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things.
verses.ct: The nations of the world chase after all these things, but your Father already knows you need them.

verses.kjv: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.web: But seek God’s Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.ct: Instead, seek the kingdom of God, and all these things will be given to you as well.

verses.kjv: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
verses.web: Don’t be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, little flock, because it is your Father's joy to give you the kingdom.

verses.kjv: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.
verses.web: Sell that which you have, and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don’t grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn’t fail, where no thief approaches, neither moth destroys.
verses.ct: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Make for yourselves purses that never wear out — a treasure in the heavens that never runs out, where no thief can reach it and no moth can destroy it.

verses.kjv: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.web: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.ct: Because wherever your treasure is, that's where your heart will be too.

verses.kjv: Let your loins be girded about, and your lights burning;
verses.web: “Let your waist be dressed and your lamps burning.
verses.ct: "Stay dressed and ready for action, with your lamps burning.

verses.kjv: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
verses.web: Be like men watching for their lord, when he returns from the wedding feast; that when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.
verses.ct: Be like servants waiting for their master to return from a wedding feast, so that when he arrives and knocks, they can open the door for him right away.

verses.kjv: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.
verses.web: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most certainly I tell you that he will dress himself, make them recline, and will come and serve them.
verses.ct: How blessed are those servants whose master finds them alert and waiting when he comes! I tell you the truth — he will put on an apron, seat them at the table, and come out to serve them himself.

verses.kjv: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find them so, blessed are those servants.
verses.web: They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch, and finds them so.
verses.ct: Whether he comes at midnight or even later, those servants are blessed if he finds them ready.

verses.kjv: And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.
verses.web: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.ct: But understand this: if the homeowner had known what hour the thief was coming, he would have stayed awake and never let his house be broken into.

verses.kjv: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.
verses.web: Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don’t expect him.”
verses.ct: So you must be ready too, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour you don't expect."

verses.kjv: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?
verses.web: Peter said to him, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everybody?”
verses.ct: Peter asked, "Lord, are you telling this parable just to us, or to everyone?"

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?
verses.web: The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?
verses.ct: The Lord replied, "Who then is the faithful and wise manager that the master puts in charge of his household to give them their food at the proper time?

verses.kjv: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
verses.web: Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.
verses.ct: That servant is blessed if the master finds him doing exactly that when he arrives.

verses.kjv: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.
verses.web: Truly I tell you, that he will set him over all that he has.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth — the master will put him in charge of everything he owns.

verses.kjv: But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;
verses.web: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My lord delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken,
verses.ct: But suppose that servant says to himself, 'My master is taking a long time coming,' and starts beating the other servants, both men and women, and starts eating and drinking until he's drunk.

verses.kjv: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
verses.web: then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn’t expecting him, and in an hour that he doesn’t know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful.
verses.ct: That servant's master will show up on a day he doesn't expect, at an hour he doesn't know. The master will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unfaithful.

verses.kjv: And that servant, which knew his lord’s will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
verses.web: That servant, who knew his lord’s will, and didn’t prepare, nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes,
verses.ct: The servant who knew his master's wishes but didn't get ready or carry them out will receive a severe beating.

verses.kjv: But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.
verses.web: but he who didn’t know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked.
verses.ct: But the one who didn't know and did things deserving punishment will receive a lighter beating. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded. And from the one entrusted with much, even more will be expected.

verses.kjv: I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?
verses.web: “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.
verses.ct: "I came to set the earth on fire, and how I wish it were already blazing!

verses.kjv: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!
verses.web: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!
verses.ct: But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it's completed!

verses.kjv: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:
verses.web: Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.
verses.ct: Do you think I came to bring peace to the earth? No, I tell you — I came to bring division.

verses.kjv: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.web: For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.ct: From now on, a family of 5 will be split apart — 3 against 2 and 2 against 3.

verses.kjv: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
verses.web: They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
verses.ct: Fathers will turn against sons and sons against fathers, mothers against daughters and daughters against mothers, mothers-in-law against daughters-in-law and daughters-in-law against mothers-in-law."

verses.kjv: And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.
verses.web: He said to the multitudes also, “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it happens.
verses.ct: Then he said to the crowds, "When you see clouds forming in the west, you immediately say, 'Rain is coming,' and it does.

verses.kjv: And when ye see the south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.
verses.web: When a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be a scorching heat,’ and it happens.
verses.ct: When the south wind blows, you say, 'It's going to be scorching hot,' and it is.

verses.kjv: Ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?
verses.web: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don’t interpret this time?
verses.ct: You hypocrites! You know how to read the weather by looking at the earth and sky, so why can't you read the signs of this present time?

verses.kjv: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?
verses.web: Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.ct: And why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?

verses.kjv: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, as thou art in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.
verses.web: For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
verses.ct: When you're on your way to court with someone who has a case against you, do everything you can to settle it before you get there. Otherwise, they may drag you before the judge, the judge will hand you over to the officer, and the officer will throw you in prison.

verses.kjv: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.
verses.web: I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny.”
verses.ct: I tell you, you won't get out until you've paid back the very last penny."
